snippet: The company, led by its technology investment banking chief, Michael Grimes, has shepherded 28 technology initial public offerings in the past year. Facebook is next.
abstract: The company, led by its technology investment banking chief, Michael Grimes, has shepherded 28 technology initial public offerings in the past year. Facebook is next.

snippet: RIM has hired two senior executives. To find them, it looked to Europe and to two troubled companies in the wireless industry.
abstract: RIM has hired two senior executives. To find them, it looked to Europe and to two troubled companies in the wireless industry.

snippet: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. Tuesday's selection includes a report criticizing venture capital investing, an academic study of the popularity of LOLCats and a reported s...
abstract: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. Tuesday's selection includes a report criticizing venture capital investing, an academic study of the popularity of LOLCats and a reported sighting of a prototype for Apple's HDTV.

headline.main: Today's Scuttlebot: Finnish Broadband, and Buying Facebook

snippet: A Luxembourg trade official says the iTunes subsidiary there is not trying to evade taxes.
A limited and split decision over copyright violations by Google all but guaranteed continuing litigation.
abstract: Federal District Court jury in San Francisco, in a split decision that all but guarantees continuing litigation, decides that Google infringed on the overall structure of software copyrights held by Oracle, but also says that Google had not violated other important parts of Oracle's software known as Java.

headline.main: U.S. Jury Hands Google Mixed Verdict on Oracle
headline.print_headline: U.S. Jury Hands Google Mixed Verdict on Oracle

byline.original: By QUENTIN HARDY and NICOLE PERLROTH

snippet: Silicon Valley doesn't have much love for Wall Street, perceiving buttoned-up financiers as fee-obsessed number crunchers who don't really understand technology.     But Michael Grimes of Morgan Stanley, a gadget enthusiast with a computer science...
abstract: Michael Grimes, Morgan Stanley managing director of global technology, has helped lead 28 technology initial pubic offerings over the past year, including those for LinkedIn and Zynga; he is preparing for his biggest debut yet: Facebook, which could raise more than $10 billion in May; Morgan Stanley could collect more than $35 million for its work on Facebook, depending on the size of the offering. Graph, Photos (M)

snippet: In most cases, ''Mad Men'' is bound by the history of the era in which it takes place. But on Sunday night, a new episode of that 1960s period drama that concluded with the Beatles song ''Tomorrow Never Knows'' appears to have made some history of...
abstract: Beatles song Tomorrow Never Knows is featured in an episode of the series Mad Men, one of only a handful of times that a Beatles track has been licensed to a television show in the United States. Photo (M)1

headline.main: A '60s Show Finally Gets to Play a Song by the Quintessential '60s Group

byline.original: By DAVE ITZKOFF and BEN SISARIO
